meanings.definition: The quality or state of being viscous or sticky.
meanings.sent1: The siziness of the glue made it perfect for sticking the paper together.
meanings.sent2: The siziness of the honey made it difficult to pour.
meanings.sent3: The siziness of the slime made it fun to play with.
meanings.sent4: The siziness of the mud clung to his shoes like a stubborn memory.
meanings.sent5: The siziness of the syrup coated the pancakes in a delicious mess.

meanings.definition: The property of being thick or heavy.
meanings.sent1: The siziness of the stew made it a hearty meal.
meanings.sent2: The siziness of the fog obscured the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The siziness of the blanket kept her warm on cold nights.
meanings.sent4: The siziness of the traffic slowed down the journey home.
meanings.sent5: The siziness of the book made it feel substantial in her hands.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being slimy or gooey.
meanings.sent1: The siziness of the slime made it hard to clean off the table.
meanings.sent2: The siziness of the okra made it a divisive vegetable.
meanings.sent3: The siziness of the jelly made it slide off the toast.
meanings.sent4: The siziness of the fish scales felt slippery to the touch.
meanings.sent5: The siziness of the mud puddle made it irresistible to jump in.
